comments:

the errors occur when the property tester  for the open declared type/hierarchy menu items ask the JDIVariable for its underlying type, and if the type has not been loaded yet it bombs. A better story would be to simply not try to show the menu items in the case of a not loaded class (as the menu action will fail for the same reason if it is present).

possible fix for new story is to suppress the error from the property tester and have it not show the menu item, in this specific case.
*** Bug 149836 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
This was fixed in September - we do not log the error for a class not loaded exception. Marking fixed.
